events.name: MatchmakingStage
events.comment: prepare, connect, login, join, ready, play

events.name: ENDING_PACE
events.comment: Min seconds between events in the ending phase

parameters: "Room SHUTDOWN required by peer or host..."

actions.text: Usually this is not necessary, the initial avatars etc. can be used; but there are cases in which the avatars etc. get lost, e.g. if a player becomes a peer and then is promoted to host before the game starts, because the initial host disconnects.
Only the host can start the match.
The peers must wait for the host to start the match.
This happens only for the host.
This happens only for the peers. They wouldn't know when the match is started otherwise.

This happens only for the peers when the host leaves.
For the host, instead, the match would go on if the peers drop.
When the connection to the host is lost, there is no point for a peer in keeping track of the IDs.

parameters.text:
"Peers detected: " & Multiplayer.PeerCount & newline &
"Players ready: " & Players.Width & newline &
"Inbound: " & (round(Multiplayer.StatInboundBandwidth/102.4)/10) & " K/s (" & Multiplayer.StatInboundCount & "pkgs.)"  & newline &
"Outbound:" & (round(Multiplayer.StatOutboundBandwidth/102.4)/10) & " K/s (" & Multiplayer.StatInboundCount & "pkgs.)" & newline &
"Host ping: " & round(Multiplayer.PeerLatency(Multiplayer.HostID)) & ", PDV " & round(Multiplayer.PeerPDV(Multiplayer.HostID))
